intro: Castilleja hispida var. hispida, commonly known as the hispid milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its yellow to orange-red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a slender, branching stem and small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Castilleja hispida var. hispida forms symbiotic relationships with certain fungi to obtain nutrients, which is common among parasitic plants.
